page.title: 03LIFE ON A FARM
page.content: LIFE ON A FARM 1985 by DIANE ADLARD EDITED by NICHOLAS HARVEY EVERY MORNING MY DAD AND UNCLE GET UP AT 5.30am.TO MILK THE COWS AND FEED THEM.THEN I GET UP AND FEED THE LAMBS .THEN I HAVE MY BREAKFAST.THIS TIME OF THE YEAR FARMERS MAKE SILAGE.WE BAG UP THE SILAGE.WHEN IT IS READY MY DAD BALES IT.ONE DAY WE WERE MUCK SPREADING.THEN WE HAD TO STOP THE TRACTOR.MY DAD TRIED TO LOOSEN THE WIRE.THEN IT WENT UP IN FLAMES.ONLY PART OF THE ENGINE WAS DAMAGED.WE PUT THE FIRE OUT WITH SOME WATER.WE WENT BACK AND TOLD MY UNCLE WHAT HAPPENED. THEN I HAD TO GO TO SCHOOL.
